content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Singapore International Water Week" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(April 2023)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* The **Singapore International Water Week** (SIWW) is a conference in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) for the global [water industry](/wiki/Water_industry). SIWW's flagship programmes include The Water Leaders Summit, the Water Convention, the Water Expo, Business Forums, Hydro-Gen and Industrial Water Solutions. The programme culminates with the [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) Water Prize. SIWW was launched in 2008. Since 2012, SIWW has been held biennially in conjunction with the [World Cities Summit](/wiki/World_Cities_Summit) and CleanEnviro Summit Singapore. In 2013, the attention was focused on the [water utility](/wiki/Water_utility) sector with the SIWW Water Utilities Leaders Forum (SWULF). In 2018, the SIWW featured and served NEWBrew, a beer brewed from [NEWater](/wiki/NEWater). In 2021, the SIWW was held virtually. - Official site - Water-Conferences.com
title: Singapore International Water Week
